refnamediv.refpurpose: estimate the condition number of a sparse matrix

refsynopsisdiv.title: Syntax
refsynopsisdiv.synopsis: [K1] = condestsp(A, LUp, t) [K1] = condestsp(A, LUp) [K1] = condestsp(A, t) [K1] = condestsp(A)

listitem.para: a real or complex square sparse matrix
(optional) a positive integer (default value 2) by increasing this one you may hope to get a better (even exact) estimate

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Give an estimate of the 1-norm condition number of the sparse matrix A by Algorithm 2.4 appearing in :
refsection.programlisting: "A block algorithm for matrix 1-norm estimation with an application to 1-norm pseudospectra" Nicholas J. Higham and Francoise Tisseur Siam J. Matrix Anal. Appl., vol 21, No 4, pp 1185-1201
refsection.para: Noting the exact condition number K1e = ||A||_1 ||A^(-1)||_1, we have always K1 <= K1e and this estimate gives in most case something superior to 1/2 K1e
